Idioms.phrase: A fool and his money are soon parted
Idioms.definition: A foolish person is very likely to lose his money.

Idioms.definition: Failure is certain if those on the same side argue amongst themselves.
A person who comes to the aid of another when other hopes have faded, like the knights in romantic stories.

Idioms.definition: You cannot change your innate self.

Idioms.definition: A kindred spirit. someone who thinks as i do.

Idioms.definition: Anything you save has the same effect as adding to your income.

Idioms.definition: The use of excessive resources to overcome a small problem.

Idioms.definition: A small effort made at the right time might save a calamity later on.
A short distance.

Idioms.definition: Mistreatment you receive in retaliation to that you gave to others.
A persistent and difficult to ignore annoyance.

To further a loss. to make a bad situation worse.

Said by someone who has experience of a situation.

Idioms.definition: With no delay.
